TEXT.TITLE: U.S. SENATORS PROPOSE BAN ON TOSHIBA IMPORTS
TEXT.BODY: Three U.S. Senators said they will propose a temporary ban on imports of all Toshiba products due to the company's illegal sales of sensitive high-technology goods to the Soviet Union. Senator Jake Garn, John Heinz and Richard Selby said at a hearing of the senate banking committee on export control, they will offer the proposal as part of a major trade bill when it is brought before the senate this summer. Garn, a Utah Republican, said "I am talking about specific retribution on a company that endangers the security of their own country and ours." Reuter
